fields.summary: Nesting not functional under EPIC issue types for Company managed projects

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 2nd December 2022|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your ongoing patience as we work on this bug.

We are currently in the process of testing a fix. This fix has been rolled out to 5% of customers so far and we've seen positive results. The roll out will get progressively faster as we gain confidence it works across all domains and projects. We're projecting a full roll out by the end of next week if things continue to go well. Thank you again for your patience and keep an eye out on this ticket for further updates.

The Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

This is reproducible on Data Center: yes
When using EPIC issue type in Company managed projects, nesting of tasks is not functional.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 ## Create an EPIC issue type within a company managed project
 ## Create a task and associated subtasks
 # Step 2
 ## Refresh the list view, and all tasks and subtask will show up at the top level and not nested

h3. Expected Results

The tasks and subtasks are all expected to stay in a nested form as shown

!Screen Shot 2022-07-11 at 3.06.46 PM.png|width=505,height=146!

 
h3. Actual Results

This is how the tasks and subtasks within EPIC issue type are showing up

!Screen Shot 2022-07-11 at 3.05.55 PM.png|width=454,height=141!
h3. Workaround

Contact support

comments.body: I would love for this to be fixed! Thank you!
Having this intermittently effect projects in client's environments; thanks for looking into this issue! Hope resolved soon
It would be great to have this fixed indeed!
This is a blocker for getting some of our new projects adopted. Would *love* to see it fixed soon!
Need fixed!
upvote
please fix :(
fix is urgently required
This is an urgent need for my teams.
We need an urgent fix on this!

Hey folks,

Just giving you an update as understandably this is a frustrating issue for you in using your Jira Work Management list view. There is a fix for this, but unfortunately the rollout for it had to be paused due to causing a regression in Jira Software boards.

However, if you don't use Jira Software, we can ask support to look at turning this fix on for your site and seeing if the issue gets resolved for your JWM list view.

 

I apologise for the inconvenience, and we are working towards being able to enable this for everyone.

 

Kind regards,
Wilson Wong
Jira Work Management Developer

Wilson - my team is not on Jira Software and we don't plan to be, so I'd love to see if we can get a fix for our JWM account. How do we go about that? I've already been working with a support person on possible fixes, but we were waiting to see if the fix that was planned for end of this month globally would take care of things, but it looks like that isn't happening now. :(
Wilson - if we are on Jira software, when can we expect this to be fixed? It is critical a feature of project organization and management.
Wilson - When can we expect the fix to be released? We encounter this in the timeline view as well as the list, and it therefore is critical for our organization.

Hi Team,

Thank you for your understanding and patience. We do apologise for the inconvenience this bug has caused. 

There is a temporary fix for this bug however this fix has other side effects that currently our development team are working on. This is the reason that the fix is not deployed widely. The side effect is that the Cloud sites that have Jira Software classic Kanban and Scrum board will be affected by [JSWCLOUD\-23456: The temporary fix for JWMCLOUD\-266 will cause continuous update modal when subtask card is moved to done column|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-23456]. The workaround for this side effect is to refresh the page.

If the side effect is not a concern for your team, please log a ticket with support so we can deploy the fix into your cloud instance.

Kind regards 
{color:#0052cc}_Fariba_{color} 
{color:#5e6c84}Atlassian Cloud Support{color}
Can we get an update on when this bug will be resolved and fix deployed more widely?

I don't think is should be considered Severity 3 - Minor. It might only be a cosmetic change in the UI, but it renders Work Mgmt non-functional without foundational functionality.

Most users work off the List or Timeline view. No one goes into each individual card to look at child issues.
Hi guys, are there any updates?

Hey folks, 
The blocker preventing wider rollout of the fix for this issue is being worked on and can be tracked here -> https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-23456

If the side effect of this bug which only affects Jira Software is not a concern for your team or you don't use Jira Software, please log a ticket with support so we can turn on the fix for this issue for your cloud instance and try to resolve the issue for your Jira Work Management views.

 

Kind regards,
Wilson Wong
Jira Work Management Developer

Just out of curiosity: If the linked issue is already being worked on ... shouldn't it be "in progress" then instead of "short term backlog"?

Best regards,
Roland

Hello, 

For many users, it's more than only cosmetic, it's an essential feature that affects the organization of every project. 
This problem is getting really annoying. 

Can we please get an update on this?

Thank you,
Arthur

hej,

any news on this issue? waiting since 3rd August where it was told it is in "short-term backlog". Seems to be a longer term :(

Best

Jonas

Hey, 

We have a fix for this and are looking at rolling it out next week.

Thanks for your patience.

 

Kind regards,
Wilson Wong
Jira Work Management Developer

hello,

this is great news.

thank you for the info

Michael

Hi Wilson,

Are you still planning on rolling this out this week/weekend?

Thanks,

Jake
+1 - very much looking forward to the fix!

Hey folks,

Just another quick update, the fix was validated on all the test instances that support engineers provided us with.

This fix will have to be applied to individual sites, so if you're in contact with a support engineer regarding this bug please reach out to them to coordinate turning this fix on for your site next week.

 

Kind regards,
Wilson Wong
Jira Work Management Developer

Hi Wilson,
so this means, the fix will not be rolled out in general but only per individual request, right?
As we are not yet in contact with support regarding this, we will have to contact support first. Will referencing this issue here be sufficient for requesting the fix?

Additionally, can you provide any information about the reasons for this procedure? Why the individual way?

Thanks and best regards,
Roland

Hi [~d40f27b035a4] ,

Yes, if you are not yet in contact with support, you'll have to raise another ticket and reference back to this issue here.

There's some technical reasons requiring a rollout in this manner unfortunately, so please get in touch with support and we hope we can resolve this for you soon.

Kind regards,
Wilson Wong
Jira Work Management Developer

Hi @Staff,

How are free users like me supposed to get important bugfixes like this? I am not allowed to contact the support.

This feature is very much needed and i can not understand how it is not rolled out to the public. After working for just an hour with the new platform I already recognized this missing feature...

How am I supposed to switch to the cloud when there are such mandatory issues?

 

I appreciate your help.

Best regards,

Alex

As I understood from reply to my support request, the provided fix is not final but considered "temporary" and still comes at the price of the other linked bug.

From the latest comments regarding _availability_ of this fix, it was not clear to me, that it would still be a trade-off.

With the linked issue still not showing a "in progress" state (still "short term backlog"), even though it was stated earlier that it was already being worked on, the overall situation is very disappointing to me.

Best regards, 
Roland
Another 2 weeks passed ... no updates on this?

@Roland - I raised a support ticket requesting the fix be applied to my account yesterday and they did it within a couple hours. I was told that this fix does NOT affect Jira Software like it had been back in September.

I'm really sorry and would appreciate an up-to-date overview of what the current status of this issue is as from all the comments so far and my experience with support I'm really confused.
Will the fix be applied globally?
Does the fix applied by the support affect anything in Jira?
What should the request to support be like, as my request was answered but 3 weeks now and the fix is not applied?

Thanks!
Just ran into this bug less than a day before pitching to leadership to adopt JWM. This is a bad look :(

Hi [~82a3c3c67cd8] , we have a [fix|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JWMCLOUD-266?focusedCommentId=3186048&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-3186048] we can deploy to your cloud instance if you could provide it to us. Please let me know if you have any further questions.

 

Thanks,

Giuseppe

fields.summary: TMP Resolution field does not change to resolve when issue move to done

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In JWM projects we don't add resolution fields into our templates (we choose not to do it), however, this field is still visible in the issue navigator and might cause confusion. In CMP the customer can always create a post function to make this transition to resolved happens, but there is no workaround in TMP
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move a ticket to “done” or any status that means resolve

h3. Expected Results

Resolution field to be resolved
h3. Actual Results

The resolution field stays unresolved
h3. Workaround

You can create an automation to change the value of the field Resolution to "Done", once the issue is transitioned to Done.

This is accessible via *_System » Global Automation_*

!Automation Resolution.png|thumbnail!

comments.body:
FYI

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Work-Management-Questions/Resolution-in-team-based-project/qaq-p/1983515?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=topic#U1983985

Workaround was useful - but getting there was the worst!
Because you can't find the field itself in the project and obviously you try and self-solve it really hurts to see that it's a poorly configured template at the end of the day.

This appears to be closely related, if not duplicated by https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JWMCLOUD-210

The Created vs. Resolved and Created Issues reports built into the template will not reflect resolved issues because no resolution is set, and there is no option to do so aside from automation.

fields.summary: Adding custom holidays does not reflect in Jira calendar view

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding custom holidays does not reflect in Jira calendar view
This is reproducible on Data Center: (yes)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add custom holidays to your agile board

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results
The actual holidays are to be shown in red

h3. Actual Results
The default Sat/Sun is highlighted in red.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.summary: When Lexorank duplicate rank problem is fixed through REST API, it does not clear the failure reason

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is reproducible on Data Center: yes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deliberately update the database so that two rows in the "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" table have the same Rank value. 
 # Run the Lexorank check in the UI.  It will fail on the last test - the duplicate rank test. 
 # Follow the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-duplicate-rank-values-for-a-rank-field-779159224.html] to get the results of the integrity checks from the endpoint /rest/greenhopper/1.0/lexorank/integrity.  The last check will fail and list the failure reason with the duplicated value.  
 # Run the REST API call via Postman to fix the duplicate rank. 
 # Run the integrity check again from the endpoint   /rest/greenhopper/1.0/lexorank/integrity.  

h3. Expected Results

It will have fixed the Lexorank duplicate and clear the failure reason. 
h3. Actual Results

The duplicate rank issue is fixed and the test passes but it still lists a failure reason:
{noformat}
"name":"Duplicate ranks check","description":"Checks if there are any duplicate rank values for a rank field.","passed":true,"failureReason":"Detected duplicate ranks for rank field 10100 : {0|i0001j:=2}","fatal":false  {noformat}
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

comments.body:
It looks like the command explained in the KB article referred above for fixing the duplicates actually fixes one duplicate at a time. Running the command several times until getting no error message for duplicate values, fixes the problem at the end. In my case I had to run the fix command around 25 times to fix all duplicates on Jira V.8.20.7. Maybe it helps for those with low number of duplicate LexoRank duplicate rank values.

.

Thanks Akyildiz :)

I'm actually the reason this defect was open since I tried using the REST API to resolve the issue in our production environment and ended up doing DB mod.

Good to know I just need to run the REST API call a few times :)
This impacts us on 8.20.2

fields.summary: The development status summary panel is timing out when under heavy load even if data is available

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The development status summary panel is timing out when under heavy load even if data is available
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect a DVCS integration (Bitbucket, Gitlab or Github) with a linked issue
# Open 30+ tabs that auto-refresh (can use http://www.dummysoftware.com/easy-auto-refresh/?ref=chrome for this)
# In a separate browser open that same issue and refresh a few times until you see an error message about timeout or failure to load under the dev panel:
 !Screenshot 2021-06-09 at 16.22.00.png|thumbnail! 

The following exception is thrown into logs:
{noformat}
2021-06-09 15:02:19,323+0100 http-nio-2990-exec-218 WARN admin 902x36691x25 eeeqnf 127.0.0.1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [c.a.j.p.devstatus.provider.DefaultCoordinator] GitLab (timeout after 5000ms, cached data returned)
{noformat}

There’s only 15 threads max that can fetch DVCS data at a time so this is causing contention:

{code:java}
   this.dvcsDataFetcherExecutor = ThreadPool.builder()
                .name("dvcs." + dvcsType())
                .maxThreads(15)
                .boundedQueue(QUEUE_SIZE)
                .build();
{code}

and the call to timeout. Note that increasing the timeout will not help here.


h3. Expected Results
DVCS data related to the issue should load in the Dev Panel.
h3. Actual Results
Data is not loaded into the dev panel which should return either the cached existing data or the new one stored into DB after soft or hard sync.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
